title: IT-Support | Förstalinje: Details
description:
**Job Description**
 Att arbeta på Coherent innebär att vara en del av ett globalt teknikbolag i framkant. Coherent är en av världens ledande aktörer inom fotonik, laserteknik och avancerade material, med omkring 35 000 medarbetare i över 20 länder. Våra lösningar används i allt från industriell tillverkning och halvledare till medicinteknik, forskning och kommunikation. Som medarbetare på Coherent får du möjlighet att utvecklas både professionellt och personligt i en organisation som kombinerar starkt lokalt engagemang med internationellt samarbete.
   

  

 Som IT Support på Coherent får du en vardag som är både tydlig och varierad. Du arbetar på plats i våra lokaler i Järfälla, där du stöttar kollegor i både renrums- och kontorsmiljön. Rollen handlar mycket om att ge praktisk hjälp: se till att datorer och tillbehör fungerar, installera och felsöka utrustning, hantera beställningar och konfigurering, och hjälpa användare som behöver stöd i sina system och verktyg.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvar**
* Arbeta på plats med förstalinjessupport i vår renrumsproduktion och på våra kontorsplatser.
* Hantera klienthårdvarans livscykel: beställning, mottagning, inventering och konfiguration av stationära datorer, bärbara datorer och tillbehör.
* Koordinera reparation och återställning av klienthårdvara med varierande ålder och operativsystem.
* Patcha nätverksuttag, vitlista och domänansluta produktionssystem och tillbehör.
* Hantera och tillhandahålla mobiltelefoner och abonnemang samt supportera lokala mobila tjänster och lösningar.
* Hantera skrivare och konferensrumsutrustning.
* Onboarding, offboarding och användaradministration.
* Samarbeta med kollegor både lokalt och internationellt, inklusive team i Europa, Indien och USA.
* Bidra till lokala och globala IT-projekt med fokus på hög servicekvalitet och kundnöjdhet.


**Kvalifikationer och erfarenhet**
* Erfarenhet av liknande teknisk roll, gärna inom industri, elektronik, optoelektronik eller tillverkningsmiljö.
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, självständigt och med flera parallella uppgifter.
* Teknisk kompetens inom installation, felsökning och återställning av användarhårdvara eller testsystem.
* God samarbetsförmåga i tvärfunktionella team.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Microsofts miljöer (O365, SCCM, AD m.fl.).
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* God förmåga att prioritera och fatta genomtänkta beslut när IT-problem påverkar produktionen.


**Vår kultur**
 På Coherent arbetar vi enligt våra värderingar ICARE —
 **Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Respect och Enthusiasm** 
 — vilket präglar hur vi samarbetar, löser problem och stödjer verksamheten i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En tekniskt stimulerande miljö där du får utvecklas och bredda dina kunskaper inom IT.
* En stöttande, professionell och internationell arbetskultur.
* Ett innovationsdrivet företag i framkant.
* Subventionerad massage på kontoret och möjlighet till kvartalsvis eller årlig bonus.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och hälsofrämjande aktiviteter.


 Om du är en motiverad IT-specialist som trivs i en samarbetsinriktad, innovativ och dynamisk miljö, uppmuntrar vi dig att ansöka och bli en del av vårt team i Järfälla.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar löpande urval. Som en del av processen genomförs referenstagning samt alkohol- och drogtest innan anställning.
   

  

**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.

title: Graduate Program – Engineering | Product & Tech
description:
**Duration:** 
 8 Months to Start. Potential to Continue.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 September 2026 |
 **Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Stories have the power to make the ordinary extraordinary. They help us think bigger, see beyond ourselves, and deepen our connection with others.
   

  

 As one of the world’s leading audiobook and e-book streaming platforms, Storytel brings unlimited listening to millions of users across 25+ markets. Driven by our purpose “Leading the future of storytelling, we move the world through stories”, Storytel Group inspires and entertains people around the world by blending innovation with tradition. We bring stories to life across various formats for everyone to discover. Anytime. Anywhere.
   

  

 Now, we’re inviting ambitious graduates to join our newly started Graduate Program within the
 **Product & Tech organisation** 
 and help shape how those stories are experienced.
   

  

**About The Graduate Program**
* Real projects with real impact: Work on live products, features, and technical challenges that directly enhance the Storytel user experience.
* Rotations across teams: Gain hands-on experience through structured rotations across engineering, helping you develop a broad understanding of how we bring our stories to life.
* Guided learning journey: Follow a structured development plan designed to help you strengthen both your technical and soft skills.
* Mentorship & coaching: Learn from experienced professionals across Product & Tech, with regular feedback and career guidance.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Partner with engineers, designers, data scientists, and product managers on high-impact initiatives.
* Community & connection: Join a global network of Storytellers who value curiosity, inclusion, and creativity.


**About You**
 We’re seeking curious, driven, and collaborative graduates who are ready to grow with us.
   

  

 Candidates must have completed, or will have completed by the program start date, a Master’s degree (or equivalent) in a relevant technical field, e.g. Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, or similar, and may have zero to two years of post-academic work experience.
   

  

 You’re passionate about technology and storytelling, eager to learn, and thrive in a fast-moving, collaborative environment. Strong English communication skills are required; Swedish is a plus.
   

  

 What We Offer
   

  

* An 8-month fixed-term contract with a competitive monthly salary.
* After completing the program, you’ll be well-positioned to take on new responsibilities, with potential opportunities to continue your career within the Storytel Group.
* Rotations across multiple teams to broaden your experience and understanding of our product and technology ecosystem.
* A structured learning journey combining training, mentorship, and hands-on experience.
* A creative, inclusive culture built on trust and collaboration.
* A chance to learn how the best-in-class streaming app is built and how it serves millions of users every day.


**Join a world of stories**
 At Storytel, we’re a team of creative story lovers who thrive on collaboration and new ideas. Our workplace is friendly, dynamic, and full of opportunities to experiment and make an impact. We believe in trust, flat hierarchies, and empowering you to grow with us.
   

  

 Does this sound like your next story? Simply fill out the application form and share your CV or LinkedIn profile. Answer a few questions, and you’re all set.
   

  

 The role is based in Stockholm, and at this time we are prioritizing candidates who are already located in Sweden.
   

  

***The last day for submitting applications is February 28th.***
***First day of work:***
*The ambition is to have our new joiners ready to start at the end of August or the beginning of September 2026.*

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Är du en teknisk, flexibel och lösningsorienterad person som tycker om att arbeta med systemframtagning, systemdesign och flödet kring krav och verifiering när det kommer till försvarssystem?
   

  

 Har du ett intresse av att arbeta med framtidens teknik i en innovativ och växande organisation och vill hjälpa till att skapa en tryggare vardag genom att utveckla IT-system som fokuserar på samverkan inom Sverige, NATO och dess allierade?
   

  

 Då har vi rätt tjänst för dig!
   

  

**Din nya utmaning**
 Vi söker ett fåtal systemingenjörer som kan hade lite olika profil som kommer arbeta tillsammans för att lösa en stor varians av uppgifter tillsammans. Dessa områden kan inkludera:
   

  

* Krav, kravanalys och assurans
* Systemdesign kring hårdvarusystem
* Elektronik
* Test och verifiering
* IT-säkerhet


 Med en relativt liten och flexibel organisation så kommer du få en stor varians i arbetsuppgifter, arbeta inom hela projektflödet och få möjlighet att komma i kontakt med flertalet olika projekt och ta en central del i att leverera nya försvarsförmågor med kvalitet!
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Arbeta med att analysera, bryta ner och realisera systemkrav
* Definiera och dokumentera hur system skall utformas
* Upprätta spårbarhet för att säkerställa assurans mellan krav, design, implementation och tester
* Inrätta verifieringsstrategier, var och när skall delsystem testas för att säkra en fungerande slutleverans
* Ta fram testspecifikationer för olika delsystem inför olika testtillfällen
* Genomförande och analys av testresultat för att säkerställa att systemet fungerar enligt kraven


**Det här bidrar du med**
* Du har en kandidatexamen eller motsvarande utbildning inom systemutveckling, elektronik, mekatronik eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Förmåga att analysera komplexa system och identifiera problem i ett tidigt skede
* Skriva tekniska rapporter, kravdokument och testplaner på ett tydligt sätt
* Erfarenhet att arbeta med tvärfunktionella team i projekt med flera discipliner
* Förståelse kring Systems Engineering processer inkl.
+ Kravanalys och specifikation
+ Spårbarhet och förändringshantering
+ Testmetodik och strategi


 Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Du talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag i en expansiv bransch.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal (Teknikföretagen).
* Wellnessteam och friskvårdsbidrag.
* Eget Gym och omklädningsrum med bastu.
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar.
* Happiness teamet ordnar med roliga och personalvårdande aktiviteter.
* Arbete i helt nybyggda ändamålsenliga lokaler vid Rosersbergs pendeltågsstation.


**Lär känna oss**
 På MilDef blir du en del av ett företag som värdesätter praktiskt engagemang och tvärfunktionellt samarbete. Vi erbjuder möjligheten att utveckla nya kompetenser, bidra i en rad olika projekt och göra en konkret skillnad för vår verksamhets framgång.
   

  

 Är du driven och redo för en utmanande och givande roll? Ansök redan idag! MilDef.com
   

  

 För information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Viktor Attoff, Head of Projects and Solutions, viktor.attoff@mildef.com.
   

  

 Vi gör löpande urval men sista ansökningsdag är 8 mars 2026.
   

  

**Important information**
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroll och drogtest på alla våra framtida kollegor innan anställning.
   

  

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***
*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for defense and security domains. MilDef provides hardware, software and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest.
   

  

 MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*
**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales.**

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Hello,** 




  





**I hope you are doing good.** 




  





**Position – Senior Data Engineer** 




**Location – Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Experience - 8+ Years** 




**Language - English** 




**Duration - 6 months B2B Contract, It's extendable.** 




  





**Job Description**




 Cloud Data Engineering Design, build, and optimize data pipelines on GCP using BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc,cloud funtions, cloud run and Cloud Storage.Implement ETL workflows for batch and streaming data ingestion.Develop scalable data lake and warehouse architectures following best practices.Optimize query performance through partitioning, clustering, compression, and schema design.(Big query, Bigtable , spanner and fire store)Terraform , DBT knowledge is required with hand on experienceData Processing ModelingBuild realtime streaming pipelines using PubSub Dataflow (Apache Beam).Create dimensional models, starsnowflake schemas, and semantic layers. Write efficient SQL and Python for transformations and automation.Looker knowledge (very important)Orchestration AutomationAutomate workflows using Cloud Composer (Airflow).Implement CI/CD pipelines for data deployments using Cloud Build and Terraform integrated in GitHub Manage versioning, testing, and environment configuration.Security GovernanceApply IAM role-based access, service accounts, VPCSC, and encryption policies.Implement data quality checks and governance using Dataplex and validation frameworks.Ensure compliance with GDPR and internal data security standards.(Encryption and decryption concepts and use of CMEK)Operations MonitoringSet up monitoring dashboards and alerts using Cloud Monitoring Logging.Optimize resource usage to ensure costefficient data processing.Troubleshoot pipeline failures, performance bottlenecks, and data integrity issues.Collaboration Stakeholder InteractionPartner with data analysts, ML teams, and product owners to define data needs.Translate business requirements into scalable cloud architecture.Document data flows, standards, lineage, and best practices for crossteam adoption.

title: Application Maintenance Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 As an
 **Application Maintenance Engineer** 
 you will be part of a team responsible for maintaining and supporting applications, ensuring stability and performance. The role involves incident resolution, change implementation, automation, and monitoring across technologies such as Java, JavaScript, Perl, Unix shell scripting, and containerised environments.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Maintain and support applications, ensuring availability and adherence to SLAs.
* Troubleshoot and resolve incidents; perform root cause analysis and implement fixes. Automate routine maintenance tasks using scripts and tools.
* Apply changes and releases safely across Unix/Linux environments.
* Set up monitoring and dashboards for proactive issue detection. Participate in extended hours/on call support rotation when required.


**Your profile**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience in application maintenance or production support.
* Strong skills in Java, Perl, and Unix/Linux scripting. Working knowledge of JavaScript for minor fixes or enhancements.
* Exposure to monitoring tools (e.g., Grafana) and log analysis. Understanding of ITIL processes (Incident, Problem, Change). Familiarity with Docker and container basics.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


***As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.***
  

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: SEO Specialist, Marketing Activation - Permanent Position
description:
**Job Description**

**Ready to shape the future of search and make fashion discoverable for millions of customers worldwide?**




 Join our award-winning SEO Operations team as an SEO Specialist, where you’ll support key search optimization workstreams and play a key role in delivering H&M’s global organic search strategy, working on one of the most ambitious SEO programmes in the industry.
   

  





 In this role, you’ll translate business priorities into impactful SEO initiatives, driving visibility and performance across multiple markets, combining traditional SEO with AI-driven innovation to stay ahead in a rapidly evolving landscape. You’ll conduct audits, optimize content, and collaborate closely with creative, tech, and media teams to deliver a seamless, customer-centric experience across search touchpoints. Based at our vibrant Stockholm Head Office, you’ll be part of a dynamic team working on exciting global projects. Perfect for someone who loves combining analytical thinking with a business mindset.
   

  





**WHAT YOU WILL DO**




 As part of our global SEO team, you will:
   

  




* Support the SEO roadmap for strategic SEO initiatives related to ecommerce SEO and lead workstreams which shape how fashion consumers discover H&M online.
* Conduct SEO Audits, including areas such as keyword research, content gap analysis, information architecture, onsite content optimization and internal linking to maximize visibility and business performance of our ecommerce store.
* Support stakeholders from other teams to ensure that wider company initiatives are implemented in an SEO-friendly way, and present business cases of recommendations.
* Support AI search projects, including Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) and GEO-targeted strategies, ensuring that we stay ahead in delivering personalized, localized, and intelligent search experiences.
* As part of the SEO Operation team, you will work closely with the SEO Lead, SEO Strategist and fellow SEO Specialists to deliver results.



**WHO YOU ARE**



* 3+ years of experience in a dedicated SEO role. Ecommerce experience is a plus.
* Skilled at analysing and presenting data in a clear, actionable way for stakeholders.
* Hands-on experience with SEO tools (e.g. Google Search Console, GA4, Conductor/ContentKing, Semrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, keyword tracking platforms, AI search platforms, etc.).
* Strong Excel skills.
* Experience in joining and merging data sets and working with large-scale data.
* Has excellent communication skills verbally, in writing, and in presentations.
* Is fluent in English, both spoken and written.
* Please note that this role is not focused on technical SEO or outreach, but knowledge of these areas is a plus.
* Experience working with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) would be a plus.
* Experience working with Jira or similar task management platforms is a plus.



 As a person, you are
   

  




* Methodical and organized, with strong attention to detail.
* A fast learner with a passionately curious spirit and a strong interest in continuous improvement.
* Strategic, customer-focused, and business-minded with a high drive for results.
* A connector and collaborator who builds trust and strong relationships.
* Comfortable taking initiative and thriving in a fast-paced environment.


**Additional Information**

**WHO WE ARE**
  

  

  

 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





  

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
  

  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  




* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program - HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment).



**JOIN US**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things - our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





**This is a full-time permanent position based in Stockholm.** 
 The desired start date for the role is beginning of March. Apply by submitting your CV in English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  





***We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.***

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**Vi söker en Solutions Engineer till Scaly!** 
 🚀
 



  





 Vill du kickstarta din resa inom tech, utvecklas snabbt och ta ett steg in i en värld där du får ansvar, förtroende och möjligheten att påverka från dag ett? Vill du jobba med proffs och lära dig av de vassaste i branschen? Då är Scaly platsen för dig!
 



 Vi växer och letar efter dig som vill jobba nära tekniken, kunderna och affären.
 



  





**Om oss på Scaly** 




 Vi är en strategisk techpartner åt nordiska företag som vill utveckla sina verksamheter med moderna, molnbaserade lösningar. Vårt fokus ligger på IT Service Management, Customer Experience och ERP. Vi hjälper våra kunder genom hela resan: från behovsanalys och val av plattform, via implementation, till långsiktig skalning. Vi sitter i fina lokaler på Strandvägen i Stockholm med en kultur som präglas av entreprenörskap och laganda.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Solutions Engineer får du en perfekt roll i skärningspunkten mellan support, implementation och kundkontakt. Du får tydlig onboarding och coachning av erfarna specialister för att lära dig hantverket bakom professionell IT-leverans. När du blivit varm i kläderna växer ansvaret snabbt med egna kunder och projekt.
 



  





**Du kommer bland annat att:** 




 🔹 Driva kunddialoger, tolka behov och formulera krav
 



 🔹 Konfigurera och anpassa kundernas system
 



 🔹 Delta i implementationer (testa, justera, dokumentera)
 



 🔹 Följa upp användarfrågor och äga ärenden hela vägen
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har ett starkt intresse för IT och vill förstå hur system och verksamhet hänger ihop. Du är en problemlösare som trivs i dialog med användare och vill bygga en långsiktig karriär inom tech.
 



  





 🌟
 **Det är extra meriterande om du har tidigare kunskap eller erfarenhet av Helpdesk eller ITSM.** 




  





**Varför Scaly?** 




 ✅ Unik möjlighet att växa in i avancerade tech-roller
 



 ✅ Arbeta nära erfarna experter
 



 ✅ Snabbt eget ansvar och tydliga karriärvägar
 



 ✅ Resor kan förekomma (t.ex. utbildning i London/Amsterdam eller workshops i Spanien)
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Låter det här som din nästa utmaning? Skicka ett DM till mig eller maila din ansökan direkt till omid@scaly.se. Vi rekryterar löpande, så vänta inte med att höra av dig!

title: Backend Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Back-end Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has experience working with back-end micro-services on Kubernetes and loves to develop alongside a team of talented engineers.
   

  

 If you are a back-end engineer or a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create the container infrastructure platform for the company
* Coordinate with other infrastructure teams to meet goals
* Enhance delivery systems with Continuous Integration
* Improve the monitoring and alert system
* Troubleshoot issues and solve problems where needed
* Create and nurture highly available systems on Kubernetes


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in computer science, information technology, or engineering
* At least 3+ years of experience working with Kubernetes
* Strong expertise in CI/CD implementation
* Thorough knowledge of Java, Spring Boot & Azure
* Understanding of micro-service design and architectural patterns
* Familiar with complex event processing and event-driven architecture


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo

* Expleo team activities


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Kommunikatör
description:
CIKO är en omställningsorganisation som bildades 2019 av arbetsgivarföreningen Fremia och LO. CIKO verkställer Omställningsavtalen Fremia – LO som omfattar möjligheten till stöd genom omställnings- och vägledningsinsatser samt ekonomisk ersättning. Avtalen berör omkring 140 000 personer och syftar till att ge stöd till ett nytt arbete för personer som sägs upp på grund av arbetsbrist eller ohälsa, eller som vill vidareutbilda sig under anställning. Läs gärna mer om oss på ciko.se.
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag:** 




 Vill du ta ansvar för CIKOs digitala röst och skapa innehåll som når fram? Som kommunikatör ansvarar du för vår närvaro i digitala kanaler, vår webbplats och för kommunikationen kring vår nya digitala plattform
 *Trygga* 
 . Uppdraget är brett och operativt, med utrymme att påverka innehåll, struktur och strategisk inriktning. Du är ensam kommunikatör men arbetar nära kollegor inom IT, UX, rådgivning, rådgivning och ledning och rapporterar till vår VD.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Planera, producera och samordna innehåll i digitala kanaler – med särskilt fokus på Facebook och LinkedIn.
* Utveckla kommunikationen kring CIKO och vår digitala plattform Trygga – med fokus på tydlighet och användarstöd.
* Organisera kommunikation för och under CIKO:s digitala transformation.
* Ansvara för redaktörskapet på ciko.se – inklusive innehåll, struktur, tonalitet och löpande uppdateringar.
* Formulera, implementera och följa upp kommunikationsvision och kommunikationsplan.
* Säkerställa ett konsekvent och förtroendeingivande uttryck i språk och innehåll.
* Följa upp effekt, analysera utfall och bidra till fortsatt utveckling av vårt kommunikationsarbete.
* Vara ett kommunikativt stöd till andra delar av organisationen vid behov.
* Göra enklare produktion i text, bild och rörligt.



  





**Din profil:** 



* Högskoleutbildning inom kommunikation, journalistik, media eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med digital kommunikation, inklusive sociala medier och webb.
* Förmåga att självständigt planera, skapa och publicera innehåll.
* Mycket god språklig förmåga på svenska och engelska.
* Vana av att arbeta med tonalitet, budskap och struktur i kommunikation.
* Erfarenhet av enklare produktion i text, bild och rörligt.



  





**Dina egenskaper:** 




 Då vi är en liten organisation behöver du vara flexibel, van att arbeta självständigt och trygg i att ta initiativ. Du är samarbetsinriktad och lyhörd för olika kompetenser och perspektiv, och du trivs i dialogen med både kollegor och ledning. Du har en god kommunikativ förmåga och ett öga för både helhet och detaljer. Du är prestigelös och trivs med att växla mellan strategiskt arbete och operativt genomförande. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 




 Hos oss får du verka i en samhällsnyttig organisation som har en viktig roll på den svenska arbetsmarknaden. Vi erbjuder goda anställningsvillkor, förmåner och ett arbete som präglas av frihet under ansvar. På CIKO är vi ett tjugotal trevliga och kompetenta kollegor som både stöttar och utmanar varandra för att bli ännu bättre på det vi gör. Placeringsorten är Stockholm, där vårt kontor är beläget i trevliga lokaler på Krukmakargatan 21, nära Mariatorget. Tjänsten omfattar heltid med tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Signera Rekrytering. Du visar intresse genom att registrera CV och ett motivationsbrev via signerarekrytering.se, där du beskriver varför du är rätt person för rollen. Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan så snart som möjligt då urval sker löpande, dock senast den 2 mars. I rekryteringsprocessen kommer vi att använda oss av tester, intervjuer och referenstagning för en rättvis och objektiv process. Eventuella frågor besvaras gärna av Signeras konsult Josefin Johansson, tel. 070-862 09 90 eller researcher Hanna Palmsten, tel. 076-301 95 57.

title: Senior cloud-focused Software Engineer
description:
**The job**
 We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join us in building our automation and communication platform. We help solve our customers communication needs by automating repetitive tasks in help desk, sales and marketing. We are looking to do a technical shift and move parts of it to kubernetes running on AWS - do you wanna be part of it from the start?
   

  

 Software is the core part of our business at Lime and we work together in a cross-functional team for the engineering teams to get the business input. Together with our Product Owners we use ShapeUp as the agile methodology. We meet regularly and decide what’s essential to the product and how it should evolve.
   

  

 The Engineers at Lime are problem solvers who strive to understand how everything fits together. We do pragmatic solutions to hard problems, a good mix of freedom and responsibility, and most importantly – have a great time at work! We are encouraged to come up with new ideas and experiment a lot. We think long-term and our ambition is to write clean and maintainable code. We take ownership of architecture and automated testing.
   

  

 We always stick to the “best tool for the problem” approach – we listen to industry trends with interest, but evaluate if something is right for us. We do things that matter to our customers and maintain a vision to stay on the right path.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements**
**Our main stack**
* C#
* Vue
* TypeScript
* MS SQL
* Redis


**Its a real plus if you**
 Have experience with developing and hosting SaaS solutions on AWS, setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps) and previous experience in taking architectural responsibilities in projects
   

  

**Our process**
 We have a lightweight process using the latest Agile techniques with stable feature cycles, no deadlines and an emphasis on understanding the actual problem rather than specifications.
   

  

 Even though we try our best, our tech and processes are far from perfect. That’s why we are looking for like-minded craftspeople to join us on the journey to building a company and product we can be proud of!
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A stable and calm working environment
* Ergonomic workplace equipment
* Continuous education in the latest techs
* Promote personal skill development with various activities
* Commuter friendly offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Lund

title: Domain Architect - Gaming
description:
**Description** 




*Position at LeoVegas Group* 




  





**About The Role** 




 As a
 **Domain Architect (DA)** 
 , you are a lighthouse in the engineering organization. You will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and governing the architecture within your domain, with a primary focus on evolving key platforms and systems. You will ensure that solutions are scalable, reliable, and aligned with overall enterprise architecture, business objectives, and industry best practices.
 



  





  





**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:** 



* Domain Architecture Design: Develop and maintain a scalable, resilient, and business-aligned architecture for the domain.
* Collaboration: Work with stakeholders, architects, and engineering teams to ensure architectural consistency and effective implementation.
* Governance and Standards: Define, enforce, and validate architectural standards, best practices, and compliance requirements.
* Strategic Planning: Shape the domain’s technical roadmap and align it with long-term IT strategy and emerging technologies.
* Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks related to security, compliance, and technology obsolescence.
* Continuous Improvement: Evolve architecture based on business needs, technology trends, and stakeholder feedback.
* Documentation and Reporting: Maintain clear documentation and provide leadership with regular architecture updates.



  





  





**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:** 




**Essential Skills** 



* Technical Expertise: Deep understanding of technologies and tools related to cloud platforms (GCP), Java/Kotlin + Spring Boot framework, MySQL and Kafka.
* Strategic Thinking: Ability to align domain-specific solutions with broader business and IT strategies.
* Communication Skills: Strong ability to articulate complex architectural concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to tackle domain-specific challenges.
* Leadership: Ability to lead and mentor teams, driving collaboration across multiple departments and influencing architectural decisions.



  





  





**Who We Are** 




 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
 



  





  





**Benefits** 



* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.



  





**JOIN US!** 




 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
 



  





 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
 



  





 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Senior Tender Manager - Nordics
description:
We are looking to hire a
 **Senior Tender Manager** 
 to join our Public Policy team.
   

  

 This role can be based in Tallinn, London, Stockholm, Helsinki, Oslo or Copenhagen.
   

  

**About Us**
 With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.
   

  

 We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or disability.
   

  

 Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Senior Tender Manager** 
 , you will play a key role in securing and managing
 **public-sector contracts and licenses** 
 for Bolt’s ride-hailing operations across the
 **Nordic region** 
 . You will lead the development and execution of winning strategies for government tenders and regulatory licensing processes, ensuring compliance, competitiveness, and alignment with Bolt’s strategic goals in regulated markets.
   

  

 This is a role supporting local teams, providing strategic, legal, and procedural expertise to navigate public-sector frameworks, influence future tenders, and manage ongoing contractual relationships with authorities.
   

  

**Main Tasks & Responsibilities:**
* Lead and manage full-cycle B2G tender and licensing processes, from opportunity identification to contract negotiation and implementation.
* Develop and execute pre-tender engagement strategies with government authorities to position Bolt as a trusted mobility partner.
* Collaborate closely with legal, operations, finance, and policy teams to deliver compliant and high-quality bid submissions.
* Oversee procurement and licensing strategies in regulated markets, with a focus on Finland and the Nordics.
* Engage with public-sector stakeholders, including transport ministries and municipalities, to shape market access and influence policy frameworks.
* Analyze tender evaluation models and regulatory developments to ensure commercially competitive submissions and maintain strategic alignment.


**About you:**
* You have proven prior experience in tender management, public procurement, or licensing within transportation, mobility, or other regulated industries.
* You are experienced in managing government bids and licensing processes from RFP analysis through to successful implementation.
* You have a strong understanding of Nordic public-sector frameworks and procurement laws, with Finnish market experience considered a major advantage.
* You are skilled in project management and cross-functional leadership, delivering results under tight deadlines.
* You have proven ability in stakeholder engagement, building relationships with municipalities, regulators, and ministries, and producing persuasive, compliant proposals through strong analytical and writing skills.
* You have experience using Salesforce or similar CRM tools; familiarity with ride-hailing, MaaS, or Nordic digital tender platforms is a plus.


 Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!
   

  

**Why you’ll love it here:**
* Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
* Enjoy a rewarding salary and stock options, knowing that as Bolt succeeds, so do you.
* Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
* Celebrate 5 years at Bolt with a 1-month paid sabbatical to recharge.
* Connect with colleagues at annual company events and smaller team gatherings.
* Balance flexibility and in-person collaboration with our hybrid model, including at least 12 monthly in-office days.
* Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*
 Join our software development team at Tactical Functions, SAAB. We develop desktop applications, supporting our Electronic Warfare systems. Our products include analysis and visualization of data and real time feeds, big data, secure user transactions, amongst many other things.
   

  

 Electronic Warfare
   

  

 Electronic Warfare (EW) represents the ability to use signals such as radio, infrared or radar. To sense and protect. At the same time, provide the possibility to disrupt, deny and degrade adversaries’ ability to use EW.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 We develop applications where we take part of the entire product chain. We work mainly with software development, but also interact with the customer directly. You will be part of and take responsibility for all phases of our product lifecycles, from concept and idea, to development, test and delivery.
   

  

 What to expect
   

  

* Full stack development
* Software development in medium sized teams
* Agile development
* Possibility to take part of machine learning projects
* Good opportunities to grow within the company


**About Us**
 The software development teams at Tactical Functions are a technique driven unit that always strive for improvement. You can expect continuous feedback and open communication with both your manager and your team. We encourage initiatives in improving our products, development environment and ways of working. We highly value collaboration and having fun together. Furthermore, it is important to us that you have an accepting attitude towards people regardless of whom you meet. Respect and dignity should be keywords to you at all times
   

  

 Your Profile
   

  

 We are looking for a driven and curious software developer, who is eager to learn and always trying to improve yourself. You actively support and contribute to an innovative climate.
   

  

* Master’s degree in Computer Science (or related discipline), or equivalent work experience
* Good skills in programming, with Java, C++, etc. or equivalent
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 Desired skills:
   

  

* Knowledge and interest in AI/ML
* Experience with DevOps tools, eg. Jenkins, Git
* Proactive and reliable team player with good communications skills


 We are currently located in Järfälla, but will move to Solna in early 2026. Since you will collaborate with colleagues on other Saab sites, you might travel occasionally. Saab is a global company and could provide the possibility to work abroad.
   

  

 Security Vetting
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 23,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 If you are interested in what benefits you can take part of as an employee at Saab in Sweden, you can read more about them here
   

  

 Do you want to get to know our business and our people a little bit better? Here you can find some stories told by our employees.
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: Staff Research Engineer - Music
description:
We are seeking a Staff Research Engineer to join our Artist-First AI Music lab. Our team pioneers and advances state-of-the-art generative technologies for music that create breakthrough experiences for fans and artists. We invent entirely new listening experiences that center and celebrate artists and creatives. All of our products will put artists and songwriters first, through these four principles:
   

  

**Partnerships with record labels, distributors, and music publishers:** 
 We’ll develop new products for artists and fans through upfront agreements, not by asking for forgiveness later.
   

  

**Choice in participation:** 
 We recognize there’s a wide range of views on use of generative music tools within the artistic community. Therefore, artists and rightsholders will choose if and how to participate to ensure the use of AI tools aligns with the values of the people behind the music.
   

  

**Fair compensation and new revenue:** 
 We will build products that create wholly new revenue streams for rightsholders, artists, and songwriters, ensuring they are properly compensated for uses of their work and transparently credited for their contributions.
   

  

**Artist-fan connection:** 
 AI tools we develop will not replace human artistry. They will give artists new ways to be creative and connect with fans. We will leverage our role as the place where more than 700 million people already come to listen to music every month to ensure that generative AI deepens artist-fan connections.
   

  

 For more information, see this press release! https://newsroom.spotify.com/2025-10-16/artist-first-ai-music-spotify-collaboration/
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Close Collaboration: Work side-by-side with research scientists to conduct ground breaking research in music generation (diffusion, flow matching, or autoregressive models), as well as related domains like ML-based audio processing, music information retrieval, machine learning, and signal processing.
* Improve model training pipelines. You’ll debug distributed training, optimize data loading at massive scale, and ensure smooth scaling across compute environments.
* Optimize performance. You’ll profile and accelerate existing training and inference code to make experiments faster and production systems more responsive.
* Integrate models into production environments. You’ll work directly with platform and product teams to deploy models into the hands of hundreds of millions of Spotify’s users.
* Incorporate state-of-the-art research. You'll translate models and techniques described in the literature into robust, well-engineered prototypes.
* Maintain a high-quality codebase. You’ll enforce clear structure, consistency, and testing practices to support long-term maintainability on a codebase shared between members of a fast-paced globally distributed team.
* Enhance researcher experience. You’ll build internal tooling, libraries, and workflows to make experimentation, debugging, and deployment more efficient for the whole team.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have experience training or fine-tuning large machine learning models on GPUs using PyTorch or similar frameworks.
* You have experience working with cloud platforms like Google Cloud Platform, AWS, or Microsoft Azure.
* You understand how to debug problems in machine learning training code.
* You communicate effectively with global teams and are ready to work both face-to-face and asynchronously with collaborators on multiple continents.
* You have experience optimizing code for performance and can make GPUs “go brrr” (train at maximum efficiency).
* You learn new concepts and technologies quickly and keep up to date with the rapid pace of development in machine learning and AI.
* You are resourceful and proactive; when faced with blockers, you seek out solutions through research, experimentation, and collaboration.
* You’re not afraid to dig deep into the stack: working with lldb, NVIDIA Nsight, or other low-level debugging tools is a plus.
* You have a solid grasp of computer science concepts like type systems, compilers, parallelism, thread safety, encapsulation, and the like.
* You have an interest in learning more about audio processing and music information retrieval and you're excited about building amazing products that use these technologies.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location
* This team operates within the Central European and GMT time zone for collaboration.
* Core working hours are CET 3pm-6pm / EST 9am-12pm.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Security Engineer
description:
**Physical Security Engineer / Commissioning - Finland** 




  





 We are looking for a full-time, experienced Physical Security Engineer from Stockholm, Sweden (client's HQ) to travel to Kouvola, Finland on a weekly basis from Monday-Friday.
 



  





**Responsibilities**




  




* Verify and plan comprehensive physical security systems, including access control, surveillance, perimeter protection, and biometric identification.
* Work directly with clients and internal teams to define system requirements and develop technical solutions aligned with project needs and industry standards.
* Support technical sales by translating client requirements into practical security solutions and providing on-site demonstrations when needed.
* Take a leading role in the hands-on installation, configuration, and commissioning of physical security systems to ensure operational readiness and client satisfaction.
* Troubleshoot, adjust, and optimise systems during and after installation to meet project performance standards.
* Collaborate closely with project managers, engineers, and technicians throughout the project lifecycle, from initial engagement through final delivery and post-installation support.
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies and provide insights on how innovations (e.g., AI, drones, Lidar) can enhance our security ecosystem.



  





**Experience**




  




* Proven hands-on experience in the design, installation, and commissioning of physical security systems.
* Practical experience with configuring, troubleshooting, and optimising systems during deployment.
* Familiarity with one or more of the following:
* ▸ Milestone, LenelS2, Axis, Bosch, Dormakaba, Morpho, Biometric Systems, Lidar, AI-based surveillance, Drones
* Experience configuring systems is a plus, but design and implementation experience is essential from a Commissioning perspective.
* Ability to produce basic system documentation, schematics, and installation layouts.
* Strong client-facing skills with the ability to clearly communicate technical concepts and support business development activities.
* A proactive, solution-oriented mindset with the flexibility to adapt to a fast-paced project environment.

title: Co-Founder - AI Data Centre Entrepreneur
description:
**Company Description** 




 Datlantis unlocks AI scalability at the edge through innovative, sustainable underwater data centers that are deployed within offshore wind farms, next to large coastal demand centers. Our mission is to power Europe's growing AI ecosystem and ensuring its energy and digital independence. Our patent-pending technology is designed to minimise operational disruption during maintenance and maximise energy efficiency. Our team is currently part of KTH Innovation Accelerator (ranked 2nd best Sustainability Accelerator in Europe by the Financial Times), in Stockholm and we are supported by Innoenergy and NATO Science for Peace and Security Programme.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This role is based in Stockholm for a Co-Founder - AI Data Centre Entrepreneur. This is a high-stake/high-reward position where you will be working side-to-side with a co-founder with a strong background and network in the energy and offshore construction sectors. Your mission is to be the technical and commercial implementer of the aspects related to AI Data Centres, including cooling systems, networking, business models, and sales, among others, while your co-founder will lead aspects related to energy, offshore operations and funding. This is an equity-based role with no salary until an investment round or relevant grant is secured.
 



  





**Is this role right for you?** 




 This role requires an obsession with building things and seeing results. Datlantis is looking for a co-founder who is not afraid of failure/rejection and is willing to try again, leveraging the lessons learned. You will thrive if you have a mindset that puts clients first and are willing to go above and beyond to extract information from them and satisfy their requirements.
 



 You should have previous experience within the AI Data Centre sector, ideally in a helicopter-view position that mixes both technical and commercial sector-specific expertise, and want to bring out your full potential by taking crucial influence in the decision-making process.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Previous experience building startups and managing high-risk projects.
* Excellent communication, conflict-resolution and integrity.
* Capacity to lead teams independently and take ownership for the performance of entire departments.
* Technical experience designing air/liquid cooling systems, networking systems and high-density IT Hardware.
* Commercial experience selling and/or procuring data center services including Colocation, Cloud, Hybrid and others, and strong knowledge of the diverse use-cases for AI and their associated requirements.
* Strong network within the Cloud, Colocation, AI Start-ups and IT Hardware sectors.
* Profiency in some of the following softwares or market equivalents: Solidworks, ASPEN, Matlab/Simulink, Ansys, CISCO CML, AWS/Azure Cloud Ops, SalesForce

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision
description:
Our fantastic, client is a data-driven health company on a mission to revolutionise female health. Thier award-winning app and world-first rapid hormone test form the only comprehensive, personalised platform that helps women understand and optimize their hormonal well-being. Innovative test delivers quantitative hormone results in just 15 minutes, enabling real-time hormone tracking like never before.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We're seeking a Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist to lead our ML initiatives from ideation to production. You’ll design, train, and deploy models that power our at-home hormone test kits, predict symptoms and periods, and personalize the user experience inside our app. You will own the full ML workflow and deliver accurate, explainable, production-ready solutions for women’s health.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, train, deploy, and maintain ML models integrated into our mobile app
* Develop and
 **train** 
 computer vision and object detection models for hormone test kits
* Build and
 **train** 
 data-driven predictive models for symptoms, periods, and cycle insights
* Develop LLM applications and RAG pipelines
* Design experiments, validate approaches, and analyse results
* Collaborate with engineering, product, and science teams to translate insights into features
* Establish data pipelines, evaluation frameworks, and production monitoring
* Make pragmatic decisions between experimental approaches and scalable production solutions in a fast-paced startup environment



  





**What You Bring** 



* **4+ years** 
 of hands-on experience in machine learning and software development, with models deployed to production
* MSc in Computer Science, Biomedical Data Science, Biostatistics, or related fields
* Strong proficiency in Python (pandas, scikit-learn, FastAPI), SQL, and data warehouse architecture
* Experience
 **training computer vision and object detection models**
* Experience working with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, etc.) and building RAG architectures
* Strong statistical foundation and understanding of software design principles for maintainable, scalable code
* Advanced image processing expertise
* Experience with Git, cloud platforms (preferably Google Cloud), and remote-first collaboration
* Fluent English



  





 If you are a highly talented Machine Learning Engineer, that is looking for a fantastic next step in your career, please apply as soon as possible for immediate consideration.
 



  





 Interview days are being arranged.

title: Technical Project Manager - Pharma
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are looking for a Techical project manager for our pharmaceutical projects in Stockholm.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Partnering with the Project Manager to define technical direction and deliver compliant, integrated solutions that meet business needs.
* Owning the technical plan: assess design partners, lead lean practices, and ensure timely delivery of technical outputs.
* Building and lead high-performing teams, shaping objectives to achieve project outcomes.
* Managing stakeholder relationships and adapt communication to influence and maintain alignment.
* Applying manufacturing processes and technical standards throughout project execution.


**Your Profile**
* Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Science (or equivalent).
* 7–10 years’ experience delivering major capital projects (>USD 5 million) and leading teams of 5–20 people.
* Strong expertise in pharmaceutical manufacturing and GMP environments.
* Proven ability to implement lean principles, schedule technical deliverables, and drive on time results.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills; adept at networking, influencing, and resolving conflict.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 A valid work permit for Sweden is required.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Alliance Sales Manager – Verisure Sverige
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa strategiska partnerskap som bidrar till både tillväxt och trygghet för tusentals familjer i Sverige? Vi söker nu en engagerad och affärsdriven 
 **Alliance Sales Manager** 
  som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för att utveckla, förvalta och expandera våra externa samarbeten i Sverige och med möjlighet att växa partnerskap till övriga nordiska länder också. I denna nyckelroll får du möjlighet att påverka vår långsiktiga affärsutveckling genom att identifiera nya möjligheter, bygga starka relationer med strategiska partners och skapa lösningar som genererar värde för både våra kunder och vår verksamhet. Du kommer att arbeta nära ledningen och andra affärsområden för att säkerställa att våra partnerskap är hållbara, lönsamma och i linje med vår övergripande strategi. 
 







**Om rollen** 




 Som Alliance Sales Manager kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att accelerera försäljningen genom nya och befintliga allianser. Du arbetar nära ledare och team inom organisationen för att identifiera, lansera och optimera partnerskap med aktörer inom exempelvis telekom, bank, försäkring, energibolag och bostadsutveckling.
 







**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 



* Driva försäljning via befintliga allianser i linje med företagets tillväxtmål.
* Identifiera och etablera nya strategiska partnerskap.
* Leda expansion av allianser till nya nordiska marknader.
* Bygga starka relationer med externa partners och förhandla fram förbättringar.
* Samverka med interna avdelningar för att maximera resultatet av allianser.
* Dela insikter och bästa praxis med kollegor i Norden och inom koncernen.
* Ansvara för lanseringsprocesser, rapportering, prognoser och optimering kopplat till allianser.







**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Vi söker dig som behärskar engelska flytande i både tal och skrift, då det är vårt koncernspråk. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i olika försäljningsmodeller och skapa lösningar som gynnar alla parter. Din kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga är stark, och du har erfarenhet av att leda samt utbilda både interna och externa team. Du är affärsmässig, drivande och har ett tydligt fokus på att skapa förbättrade resultat genom förändringsarbete. Dessutom är du skicklig på att bygga relationer med beslutsfattare inom relevanta branscher. Vi erbjuder
 



 Rollen är baserad i Stockholm, men resor inom Europa förekommer vid behov för partnerskapsutveckling och kunskapsdelning.
 


* Är flexibel och har möjlighet att resa i tjänsten vid behov.
* Innehar giltigt B-körkort.
* Godkännande från Länsstyrelsen.
* Har relevant akademisk utbildning från högskola eller universitet.







**Företagskultur** 
  
 



 Våra medarbetare, produkter och tjänster gör skillnad i samhället varje dag då vi skapar trygghet och säkerhet för alla våra kunder. Orsaken till att familjer och småföretag förlitar sig på att vi skyddar det som är viktigast för dem beror på vårt sätt att arbeta. Det handlar om vårt DNA – ett sätt att tänka, arbeta och skapa som skiljer oss från mängden. Det genomsyrar allt vi gör, så att vi alltid tänker, förnyar, bryr oss och är redo att agera, vad som än händer.  Våra värdeord sitter inte bara på väggarna utan i varje medarbetares DNA. Det är fem starkt sammankopplade värderingar som vi lever efter varje dag:  
 







 ·   
 *Passionate in everything we do (brinna för uppgiften)* 




 ·   
 *Committed to making a difference (göra skillnad)* 




 ·   
 *Always innovating (vara bättre än igår)* 




 ·   
 *Winning as a team (vinna och fira som ett lag)* 




 ·   
 *With trust & responsibility (ge förtroende och ta ansvar)* 








**Om Oss:**





 Vi på
 

 Verisure
 

 är stolta över att skydda över 5,8 miljoner hushåll världen över. Vi är även Europas ledande leverantör av smarta säkerhetssystem för hem och företag. Vi satsar på din personliga och professionella utveckling och erbjuder en arbetsplats där innovation och kundfokus står i centrum.
 

 Vi är ett bolag
 

 i stadig tillväxt
 

 som
 

 kontinuerligt
 

 arbetar med utveckling av våra tjänster
 

 och
 

 produkter. Inom koncernen
 

 ingår
 

 flera varumärken,
 

 där
 

 Securitas
 

 Direct,
 

 Arlo
 

 och Alert Alarm
 

 är väl etablerade
 

 namn.
 
  
 







**Låter detta intressant?** 





 Tjänsten är en
 

 heltidstjänst med placering i Solna.
 

 Intervjuer
 

 sker
 

 löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag
 

 som är
 

 2026-01-12.Startdatum enl.
 

 Överenskommelse.
 

 För anställning i ett auktoriserat bevakningsföretag krävs godkännande från Länsstyrelsen.
 

 Kollektivavtal
 

 med
 

 Unionen
 

 tillämpas.
 
  
 



  
 




 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta
 

 Head of Alliances Linnéa Liljestrand via
 

 mail 
 
 linnea.liljestrand@verisure.se 
 
 eller Recruitment Manager Cassandra Malmqvist via mail  
 

 cassandra.malmqvist@verisure.se

title: Experienced Test Engineer - Automotive sökes
description:
**Beskrivning av arbetsuppgifter:**  

Main responsibilities
  
. Responsible for Function/ System-verification according to requirements.
  
. Verification on system level in HIL and test vehicle.
  
. Analysis of test results
  
. Development of future test methods (DVM)
  
. Planning and preparation of tests / test objects
  
. Participate in planning meetings.
  
. Perform requirement (Black Box), integration, regression and formal qualification testing in an agile software development process
  
. Report and document failures identified during testing
  
. Design, develop, and maintain software test plans, software test cases, software test procedures, and automated software tests in compliance with technical requirements.
  
. Work with the lead test engineer and a team of software developers to establish and develop test methods and techniques
  
. Collects test evidence that documents how the software perform during testing
  
. Documents test cases and results in a Test Case Specification and a Test Summary Report.
  
. Provides statuses to the Project and SW responsible
  
. Review technical requirement specifications regarding testability
  
. Discuss technical solutions with supplier and the internal team
  
. Troubleshoot and modify test tools and test scripts
  
. Support investigations and task force activities
  
  

**Beskrivning av kvalifikationer:****Required qualifications:**  

. Bachelor or Master degree within Electrical, Computer, Engineering Physics or equivalent level of education
  
. Experience in automotive system testing
  
. Knowledge of communication protocols CAN, LIN, FlexRay and Ethernet
  
. Experience from HIL testing (Vector and/or dSpace)
  
. Experience in test tools CANalyzer/ CANoe / vTESTstudio
  
. Experience from Functional Safety, ISO26262
  
. Test automation in Python and CAPL
  
. Experience in CI/CD tools and process
  
. Experience with requirement and test management tools (System Weaver and/or Elektra)
  
. Agile development processes
  
. Analytical and problem solving skills
  
. Fluent in English (written and spoken)
  
. B driving license
  
. Team player attitude
  
  

**Meritorious qualifications:**  

. Experience in Model-Based Design using MATLAB/ Simulink
  
. ISTQB Certification

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Är du en teknisk, flexibel och lösningsorienterad person som tycker om att arbeta med systemframtagning, systemdesign och flödet kring krav och verifiering när det kommer till försvarssystem?


Har du ett intresse av att arbeta med framtidens teknik i en innovativ och växande organisation och vill hjälpa till att skapa en tryggare vardag genom att utveckla IT-system som fokuserar på samverkan inom Sverige, NATO och dess allierade?


Då har vi rätt tjänst för dig!

**Din nya utmaning**


Vi söker ett fåtal systemingenjörer som kan hade lite olika profil som kommer arbeta tillsammans för att lösa en stor varians av uppgifter tillsammans. Dessa områden kan inkludera:

* Krav, kravanalys och assurans
* Systemdesign kring hårdvarusystem
* Elektronik
* Test och verifiering
* IT-säkerhet


Med en relativt liten och flexibel organisation så kommer du få en stor varians i arbetsuppgifter, arbeta inom hela projektflödet och få möjlighet att komma i kontakt med flertalet olika projekt och ta en central del i att leverera nya försvarsförmågor med kvalitet!

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**

* Arbeta med att analysera, bryta ner och realisera systemkrav
* Definiera och dokumentera hur system skall utformas
* Upprätta spårbarhet för att säkerställa assurans mellan krav, design, implementation och tester
* Inrätta verifieringsstrategier, var och när skall delsystem testas för att säkra en fungerande slutleverans
* Ta fram testspecifikationer för olika delsystem inför olika testtillfällen
* Genomförande och analys av testresultat för att säkerställa att systemet fungerar enligt kraven

**Det här bidrar du med**

* Du har en kandidatexamen eller motsvarande utbildning inom systemutveckling, elektronik, mekatronik eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Förmåga att analysera komplexa system och identifiera problem i ett tidigt skede
* Skriva tekniska rapporter, kravdokument och testplaner på ett tydligt sätt
* Erfarenhet att arbeta med tvärfunktionella team i projekt med flera discipliner
* Förståelse kring Systems Engineering processer inkl.


	+ Kravanalys och specifikation
	+ Spårbarhet och förändringshantering
	+ Testmetodik och strategi


Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Du talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska.

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**

* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag i en expansiv bransch.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal (Teknikföretagen).
* Wellnessteam och friskvårdsbidrag.
* Eget Gym och omklädningsrum med bastu.
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar.
* Happiness teamet ordnar med roliga och personalvårdande aktiviteter.
* Arbete i helt nybyggda ändamålsenliga lokaler vid Rosersbergs pendeltågsstation.

**Lär känna oss**


På MilDef blir du en del av ett företag som värdesätter praktiskt engagemang och tvärfunktionellt samarbete. Vi erbjuder möjligheten att utveckla nya kompetenser, bidra i en rad olika projekt och göra en konkret skillnad för vår verksamhets framgång.


Är du driven och redo för en utmanande och givande roll? Ansök redan idag! MilDef.com


För information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Viktor Attoff, Head of Projects and Solutions, viktor.attoff@mildef.com.


Vi gör löpande urval men sista ansökningsdag är 8 mars 2026.

**Important information**


Vi genomför bakgrundskontroll och drogtest på alla våra framtida kollegor innan anställning.

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***

*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for defense and security domains. MilDef provides hardware, software and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest.*  

  

*MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*

**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales.**

title: iOS Utvecklare till B3 Mobile
description:
B3 Mobile är koncernens spetsbolag för apputveckling. Vi bygger framtidens digitala lösningar tillsammans med några av världens mest spännande kunder – i Stockholm och internationellt. Våra projekt spänner över iOS, Android, Kotlin, Swift, TypeScript, React Native, Java och mycket mer.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en erfaren iOS-utvecklare som vill ta nästa steg i karriären och bli en del av vårt passionerade team.
   

  

**Rollen**
 Hos oss får du arbeta nära andra skickliga utvecklare, UX-designers och projektledare – både in-house och ute hos kund. Vi vill inte bara bygga det kunden ber om, utan gärna leda utvecklingen, modernisera och driva på användandet av de senaste teknikerna inom iOS när det behövs.
   

  

 Vi jobbar primärt med Swift och SwiftUI, men erfarenhet av UIKit och andra delar av Apples ekosystem är alltid meriterande. Kännedom om Objective‑C kan vara värdefullt, men är inget krav.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som**
* Har minst 6 års erfarenhet av iOS-utveckling
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i Swift, SwiftUI och Xcode
* Har erfarenhet av UIKit och gärna insyn i övriga delar av ekosystemet
* Har vana av byggautomatisering (t.ex. Fastlane, Xcode Cloud)
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av testning och unittester (Swift Testing, XCTest)
* Skriver ren, hållbar, läsbar, säker, modulär och testbar kod
* Är proaktiv och gillar att ta initiativ hos kund
* Har en bakgrund som civilingenjör eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Talar och skriver svenska obehindrat


**Därför ska du välja oss**
 Vi erbjuder mer än bara ett jobb – hos oss får du:
   

  

* Möjlighet att jobba med tekniskt utmanande lösningar för högprofilerade kunder.
* Friheten att alltid ha de bästa verktygen: snabb dator, gott om testtelefoner, rätt tangentbord, alla kablar och licenser du behöver – på eget initiativ.
* Flexibelt upplägg med hybridmodell (en dag i veckan på kontoret för gemenskap och kunskapsutbyte).
* En arbetsplats där du kan växa och utforska de senaste teknikerna tillsammans med ett starkt team.
* Satsningar på ditt välmående – från friskvårdsbidrag till en arbetsmiljö där balans mellan jobb och fritid är en självklarhet.


 Vi tror på energi, nyfikenhet och att dela erfarenheter. Hos oss är olikheter en styrka, och vi vill att du ska känna att du kan växa – både som utvecklare och som människa.
   

  

 För mer information kontakta VD Camilla Landén på camilla.landen@b3.se
